snippet.title: Lauderdale knows it has to keep winning
snippet.content:
IT'S an easy equation for Laud-erdale to make history and finish in the top three for the first time in its TSL existence. Sunday's 13-point win over Glenorchy has given Lauderdale a barrier of two wins over the Magpies. Lauderdale coach Darren Winter acknowledges his side has not done enough to cement a top-three spot yet.
"We are fully aware we need to keep winning," Winter said. "We still have three games left and they [Glenorchy] have a better percentage so it [third position] is still a fair way off, but it was good to get that buffer. "We have a couple of tough games coming up so if we don't look after those we will find ourselves slipping back down to fourth." Lauderdale's next match is against Burnie. "Burnie is a tough place to play footy and we haven't had a lot of success up there over the journey," Winter said. Another concern for Lauderdale is a calf injury to star Thor Boscott. "Boscott is probably our most important player [as] he can play in the middle, go across half-back and up forward," Winter said. "He is carrying a little bit of a calf injury so he may need a bit of a spell soon, during the next few weeks." The Bombers from the north could be dealt their own blow with Richter-Salter being sent to the tribunal after choosing to fight a reduced one-match ban for making contact with an umpire. The hearing is on Wednesday night.
